labels.text:
‘On June 5, 1989, a young couple waits beneath Jianguomenwai Bridge on the fringe of Beijing’s diplomatic area, as PLA tanks roll above them. Martial law had been in place since the end of May.’ 

The accompanying description is courtesy of Liu Heung Shing’s monograph, China After Mao, first published in 1983.

‘Liu Heung Shing is a photojournalist who, after completing his studies in the United States, was posted to China as one of the first foreign correspondants to gain accreditation following the normalization of diplomatic relations between China and the U.S. Arriving in 1978, Liu Heung Shing began to document the changes engendered by the reform policy, a project he continued through to the end of the twentieth century. His renowned photographs captured many major historical events including the activities of the Stars Painting Group, and the Tiananman Square incident of 1989.’
On 5 June 5 1989, a young couple waits beneath Jianguomenwai Bridge on the fringe of Beijing’s diplomatic area, as PLA tanks roll above them. Martial law had been in place since the end of May.

「1989年6月5日，一對年輕情侶在建國門外橋下，等待中國人民解放軍的坦克自橋上開過。五月底開始實施戒嚴令。」

以上文字敘述出自劉香成著作《毛以後的中國》，首版1983年。

「劉香成，紀實攝影師，在美國畢業之後被派駐中國，是中美關係正常化之後首批被委派至中國的外國記者。 1978年到北京之後，劉香成開始紀錄改革開放帶來的變化，直至20世紀末。他著名的照片捕捉了很多重要的歷史事件，包括『星星畫會』運動、1989年『天安門事件』。」
1989年6月5日，一對年輕情侶在建國門外橋下，等待中國人民解放軍的坦克自橋上開過。戒嚴令自當年5月底開始實施。

title.zh-hant: 1989年，北京，情侶躲藏在立交橋下

paper size: 119.2 × 90 cm

inscription.en:
inscribed LL in wax pencil: Bicycle and Tank 1989
numbered LC in wax pencil: 8/8

images.AltText: Photograph of a white concrete bridge and underpass. Two camouflaged tanks sit on top of the bridge. Below, a man and woman sit on a bicycle.
images.AltTextTC: 照片中顯示一道白色混凝土橋樑和下方的通道。橋上停泊着兩架迷彩坦克車，橋下一男一女同坐在一輛單車上。
